definition: transfer character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character with meanings influenced by other words/sometimes called mutually explanatory character
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]
to register/to annotate/note/comment
transfer character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character with meanings influenced by other words/sometimes called mutually explanatory character

sentences.english: Transcription is one of the six categories of traditional structural theory of Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 转注是传统汉字结构理论的“六书”之一。

sentences.english: Mutual explanation and dialects are the causes for the variant characters and pronunciations of this word.
sentences.chinese: 造成这种一词多形多音的原因是“转注”和方音。

definition: Six Methods of forming Chinese characters, according to Han dictionary Shuowen 說文|说文 - namely, two primary methods: 象形 (pictogram), 指事 (ideogram), two compound methods: 會意|会意 (combined ideogram), 形聲|形声 (ideogram plus phonetic), and two transfer methods: 假借 (loan), 轉注|转注 (transfer)
ideogram plus phonetic (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/also known as phonogram, phonetic compound or picto-phonetic character
ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character indicating an idea, such as up and down/also known as self-explanatory character
to multiply (kinds, difficulties)/to reproduce/to derive (compounds)
pictogram/one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
rhymed language
old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
thirty six initial consonants of Song phonetic theory
transfer character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character with meanings influenced by other words/sometimes called mutually explanatory character
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
two-syllable word featuring alliteration or rhyme, such as 玲瓏|玲珑[ling2 long2]
seal script used throughout the pre-Han period
repeatedly/frequently
urgent
meaning of a character
single Chinese character/word (in a foreign language)
see 通假字[tong1 jia3 zi4]
